frame.name: Measure_volume
frame.definition: <def-root>This frame is concerned with nouns that denote <fen>Unit</fen>s of measurement for volumes. The Frame Elements are <fen>Unit</fen>, <fen>Count</fen>, <fen>Stuff</fen>, and <fen>Size</fen>. The frame will be split soon into container-derived volumes (box, bottle etc.) and pure volumes (gallon, quart). For the moment we tag things as follows: <ex>Greg drank <fex name="Count">two</fex> <fex name="Size">2 liter</fex> <t><fex name="Unit">bottles</fex></t> <fex name="Stuff">of lemonade</fex>.</ex> <ex>Sue drank <fex name="Count">two</fex> <t><fex name="Unit">liters</fex></t> <fex name="Stuff">of beer</fex>.</ex> This frame necessitated the introduction of the GF: Quant and the PT: Num used for expressions such as the following: <ex>two <t>cups</t> of coffee</ex> <ment>FE: <fen>Count</fen>, GF: Quant, PT: Num</ment><ex></ex> Note that we treat cardinal numbers and "a" (= 1) in the same way. <ex>a <t>cup</t> of coffee</ex> <ment>FE: <fen>Count</fen>, GF: Quant, PT: Num</ment><ex></ex> For the present, we prefer not to annotate "many cups of coffee" <ex>many <t>cups</t> of coffee</ex> <ment>FE: <fen>Count</fen>, GF: Quant, PT: Adj</ment><ex></ex></def-root>

FE.name: Count
FE.definition: <def-root>The number of <fen>Unit</fen>s of the measured volume.<ex>Serena found <fex name="Count">two</fex> <t><fex name="Unit">cups</fex></t> <fex name="Stuff">of sugar</fex> in the freezer.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Stuff
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Stuff</fen> whose volume is being measured.<ex>Sue bought <fex name="Count">three</fex> <t><fex name="Unit">bottles</fex></t> <fex name="Stuff">of milk</fex> on sale.</ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Unit
FE.definition: <def-root>The standardized quantity in terms of which other quantities of the same kind are measured.<ex>Drink <fex name="Count">two</fex> <t><fex name="Unit">glasses</fex></t> <fex name="Stuff">of wine</fex> every day.</ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Size
FE.definition: <def-root>A specification of the volume of the container.<ex>Michell bought <fex name="Count">a</fex> <fex name="Size">2 liter</fex> <t><fex name="Unit">bottle</fex></t> <fex name="Stuff">of Sangria</fex>.</ex></def-root>

lexUnit.name: pint.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a unit of liquid or dry capacity equal to one eighth of a gallon, in Britain equal to 0.568 litre and in the US equal to 0.473 litre (for liquid measure) or 0.551 litre (for dry measure).

lexUnit.name: cup.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: chiefly N. Amer. a measure of capacity used in cookery, equal to half a US pint (0.237 litre)

lexUnit.name: bottle.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the volume of a container with a narrow neck, used for storing liquids

lexUnit.name: bushel.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a measure of capacity equal to 8 gallons (equivalent to 36.4 litre), or in the US a measure of capacity equal to 64 US pints (equivalent to 35.2 litres).

lexUnit.name: box.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the volume of a container with a flat base and sides

lexUnit.name: glass.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the volume contained in a drinking container made of glass

lexUnit.name: gallon.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: unit of volume for liquid measure equal to eight pints: in Britain also imperial gallon, equivalent to 4.55 litres; in the US, equivalent to 3.79 litres.

lexUnit.name: barrel.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a measure of capacity for oil and beer, equal to 36 imperial gallons for beer and 35 imperial gallons or 42 US gallons (roughly 192 litres) for oil

lexUnit.name: pack.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a cardboard or paper container and the items contained within it

lexUnit.name: bowl.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the volume contained by a round, deep dish or basin

lexUnit.name: teaspoon.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the amount held by a teaspoon, in the UK considered to be 5 millilitres when used as a measurement in cookery

lexUnit.name: jug.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: volume contained by a large container for liquids, with a narrow mouth

lexUnit.name: spoon.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the volume or amount held by an implement consisting of a small, shallow oval or round bowl on a long handle, used for eating, stirring, and serving food

lexUnit.name: tablespoon.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the amount held by a tablespoon, in the UK considered to be 15 millilitres when used as a measurement in cookery

lexUnit.name: bag.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the volume contained by a flexible container with an opening at the top

lexUnit.name: quart.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a unit of liquid capacity equal to a quarter of a gallon or two pints, equivalent in Britain to approximately 1.13 litres and in US to approximately 0.94 litre.

lexUnit.name: spoonful.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the volume contained in a spoon

lexUnit.name: teaspoonful.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the volume contained in a teaspoon

lexUnit.name: bagful.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the volume contained by a bag

lexUnit.name: boxful.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the volume contained by a box

lexUnit.name: bucketful.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the volume contained by a bucket

lexUnit.name: tankful.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the volume contained by a tank

lexUnit.name: sackful.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the volume or amount contained by a sack

lexUnit.name: packet.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the amount contained in a paper or cardboard container

lexUnit.name: mug.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the amount of contents of a large cup, typically cylindrical and with a handle and used without a saucer

lexUnit.name: scoop.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the volume or amount contained in a utensil resembling a spoon, having a short handle and a deep bowl, used for extracting liquids or substances from a container

lexUnit.name: scoopful.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the volume contained in a scoop

lexUnit.name: platter.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a selection of food placed on a platter

lexUnit.name: tray.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the contents of a flat, shallow container with a raised rim, typically used for carrying or holding.

lexUnit.name: busload.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a load that fills a bus

lexUnit.name: planeload.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a load that fills a plane

lexUnit.name: truckload.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a load that fills a truck

lexUnit.name: carload.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a load that fills a car

lexUnit.name: roomful.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the volume or amount a room will hold

lexUnit.name: trainload.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the size of load that fills a train

lexUnit.name: boatload.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a load that fills a boat.

lexUnit.name: litre.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a metric unit of capacity, formerly the volume of one kilogram of water under standard conditions, now equal to 1,000 cubic centimetres (about 1.75 pints)

lexUnit.name: can.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the volume contained in a can

lexUnit.name: case.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: boxful, amount contained in one carton or box
